PERSONA:
meet donna jean thompson, a 58-year-old married woman living in the metropolitan area of charlotte, north carolina, in the heart of the south atlantic region. born and raised in the united states, donna is a white non-hispanic, identifying as a very conservative protestant who was born-again as an evangelical christian. she is a high school graduate, having completed her education at myers park high school in charlotte.

donna has been married to her husband, ricky, a 60-year-old retired machinist, for 35 years. they have two grown children, both of whom have moved out of the family home - a son working as a police officer in raleigh and a daughter who works as a nurse in the local hospital. this family structure places donna in the role of a supportive partner and parent, whose conservative values stress the importance of family and community. 

despite not having pursued further education beyond high school, donna has always been resourceful and determined. she works part-time as a secretary at their local church to supplement the family income, which falls below $30,000 annually. donna's husband, ricky, collects a small pension from his years as a machinist and supplements their income by doing odd jobs.

donna's strong religious beliefs and frequent attendance at church services (more than once a week) heavily influence her political views. her very conservative stance is reflected in her allegiance to the republican party and her identification as a conservative republican. living in a metropolitan area with lower income imposes various economic challenges, including living in a modest, older home in a mixed-income neighborhood. the challenges faced by donna and her family make affordable healthcare and social security top economic concerns for them.

donna is an avid user of the internet, often staying connected through social media platforms and news websites, which helps her stay informed about political issues and events. despite her conservative leanings, donna has a strong community-oriented spirit but hasn't been actively involved in volunteer work in recent years due to her part-time job and family responsibilities.

in the upcoming election, donna's vote will likely go to the republican candidate, primarily because of their stance on social issues such as education and healthcare. donna values candidates who align with her faith and prioritize community welfare.
